title:
Conformal metrics on the four-dimensional half sphere with symmetric $Q$
  and $T$ curvatures
abstract:
In this paper, we address the problem of prescribing non-constant $Q$ and
boundary $T$ curvatures on the upper hemisphere $\mathbb{S}^4_+\subset
\mathbb{R}^5$, via a conformal change of the background metric. This is
equivalent to solve a fourth-order non-linear elliptic boundary value problem
with a third-order non-linear equation and homogeneous Neumann conditions at
the boundary. The problem admits a Mean-field type variational formulation,
similar to the one obtained by Cruz-Bl\'azquez and Ruiz for a related problem
in two dimensions, with the associated energy functional being bounded from
below but, in general, not coercive. By imposing symmetry conditions, we are
able to prove the existence of minimizers, especially when $Q,T\geq 0$. To the
best of our knowledge, these are the first existence results obtained for this
setting.
